actionDTO Data Type

Holds information about an action.

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
automations automationDefinitionDTO element 0/unbounded The automations run when the conditions for this action are met. They are run in the order of the list.
conditions conditionDTO element 0/unbounded The conditions that trigger this action. For manual actions, these conditions control when the user will see the action in the UI. For automatic actions, these conditions control when the action gets automatically fired.
custom_condition string element 0/1 The custom evaluation string to be used with logic_type = advanced. Ex: "(1 AND 2) OR 3" This field must be passed when logic_type advanced is used, and will be ignored and deleted for both other logic types.
export_key string element 0/1 This value is used for export/import to uniquely represent this field
logic_type string element 0/1 A list of logic types to apply to the conditions. The following are examples:
  • all
  • any
  • advanced
message_destinations objectHandle element 0/unbounded The list of message destination IDs for this action. See MessageDestinationREST.
object_type objectHandle element 0/1 The type of object to which this action applies (e.g. incident, task, etc.). See actionsFrameworkInfoDTO (action_object_types property) for the list of possible values.
timeout_seconds int element 0/1 The maximum amount of time in seconds that can elapse before this action has been considered to be timed out. A value of null indicates that the action should use the default timeout (currently 1 day).
uuid string element 0/1 A unique identifier for this Custom Action.
workflows objectHandle element 0/unbounded The list of workflow IDs for this action.
Properties inherited from partialActionDTO
int element 0/1 The ID of the action.
string element 0/1 The display name of the action.
int element 1/1 The type of the action (e.g. manual or automatic). See actionsFrameworkInfoDTO (action_types property) for the list of possible values.

Example

<actionDTO>
  <object_type>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </object_type>
  <conditions>
    <method>...</method>
    <field_name>...</field_name>
    <value>...</value>
    <type>...</type>
    <evaluation_id>...</evaluation_id>
  </conditions>
  <message_destinations>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </message_destinations>
  <workflows>
    <id>...</id>
    <name>...</name>
  </workflows>
  <timeout_seconds>...</timeout_seconds>
  <uuid>...</uuid>
  <export_key>...</export_key>
  <logic_type>...</logic_type>
  <automations>
    <type>...</type>
    <type_id>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
    </type_id>
    <field>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
    </field>
    <operation>...</operation>
    <tasks_to_create>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
    </tasks_to_create>
    <scripts_to_run>
      <id>...</id>
      <name>...</name>
    </scripts_to_run>
    <value>...</value>
  </automations>
  <custom_condition>...</custom_condition>
  <id>...</id>
  <name>...</name>
  <type>...</type>
</actionDTO>
